history.content: Tbh overall looks fairly light, I would recommend looking at taking more upper divs and fewer breadths (you have 9 slots, and AC/breadth can be one class). It's hard to tell what part of CS you're interested in because your suggested schedule is so general, but the EECS and HKN websites have course groupings you could look at.

children.subject: Yes, my AC rn covers both AC and social sciences, so on that front I'm good.

I have 20 credits from IB, so that covers it.

I was thinking I would do 53 to fill in next to 70, because I sure as hell ain't doing EE 16A/B with 70 since they're both known to be massive time-sucks.

I will look at other CS courses to fill for the UDs.

Thanks!

do you have a bunch of AP credits?  Doing the math, the 7 semesters leaves you at around 105-108 credits.

Although it's not necessary at all to follow this, it's a good idea to take at least EE16A before CS70 just to get more mathematical maturity in.  On the other hand, Math 53 is not required unless you plan on taking CS 189 (or some higher Math or Physics classes).

You have way too many breadths, 6 is all you need (Physical Science is already covered by 61C).  You'll need a minimum of 9 upper division classes, of which you've only marked your 5.   You'll probably want to replace 4 of those classes you marked as Breadth with upper division courses, preferably all related to CS.  The upper division CS schedule looks rather lightweight so far, outside of the 17x classes.

Are you going for a Data Science Minor?

Definitely! The only reason I look at 169 and 172 is that those are the classes offered at a study abroad destination that is transferable back to Cal. Plans could change, but that's my ideal case for now.

Other than the suggestions my peers made, I'd recommend keeping your options open for upper divs. I tried to super plan everything when I was a freshman and ending up completely changing my mind... originally thought I was going to take EE 120, 123, 126,  CS 188, 189 and no systems classes. Actually ended up doing the opposite after taking all the lower divs. Maybe just think about possible alternatives in case stuff happens. For example, if you absolutely hate 170, you will definitely despise 172 (which btw, might not even be offered on the semester you are planning to take it). Maybe you end up doing two Facebook internships by the time you would take 169 and then decide it is no longer that useful. Keep your mind open :)

Another smaller thing to note: You only need 7 breadths so anything additional would be additional coursework. On top of that, cs188 and cs61c count for physical science breadth, so in reality, you can knock off two of the "breadth" classes from your schedule shown above. Hope this helps to add more slots for other useful upper divs as well.
